definition: lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
(coll.) profit-motivated article cynically disguised as feel-good content 雞湯|鸡汤[ji1 tang1] and designed to go viral
(slang) to have fun by oneself/to amuse oneself
chicken stock/chicken soup/(fig.) chicken soup for the soul – i.e. feel-good motivational stories (often used disparagingly because the stories don't really effect change in people's lives)
lit. to pour cold water on/fig. to dampen one's enthusiasm
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
(jocularly) to be under great pressure (a pun on 亞歷山大|亚历山大[Ya4 li4 shan1 da4])
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
